title: Computer Searching of the Medical Literature
abstract: Letters and Corrections1 May 1986Computer Searching of the Medical LiteraturePATRICIA K. SMITH, M.L.S.PATRICIA K. SMITH, M.L.S.Search for more papers by this authorAuthor, Article, and Disclosure Informationhttps://doi.org/10.7326/0003-4819-104-5-723_1 SectionsAboutPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissions ShareFacebookTwitterLinkedInRedditEmail ExcerptTo the editor: The conclusions of Haynes and colleagues (1) in their evaluation of MEDLINE searching systems are not supported by my years of experience as a professional searcher.The ostensible purpose of the study was to evaluate mechanisms for the clinician to access MEDLINE or other online services. The authors correctly assess that most general practitioners are behind in their knowledge of the literature. My experience as both a professional searcher and a patient support this conclusion. Obstetricians routinely suggest a diagnostic test on the basis of data that were superseded several years ago by a definitive study. In...Reference1. HAYNES R, MCKIBBON K, and WALKER C. Computer searching of the medical literature: an evaluation of MEDLINE searching systems. Ann Intern Med. 1985;103:812-6. LinkGoogle Scholar This content is PDF only.
